Can only be activated if the driver is an Infiltrator.  Activate to cloak the Flash.  Cloaking the Flash makes it and the riders nearly invisible, breaks lock-ons, prevents it from being spotted but also prevents it from firing.  Lasts until fuel is consumed or turned off.
When activated, the Fire Suppression System will repair damage for 5 seconds.  If the vehicle is on fire when activated, it will also immediately extinguish the fire.
Nanites repair damage over time as long as the vehicle has not taken damage within a few seconds.
Detects the movement of hostile soldiers near the vehicle and reveals them on the mini-map for all vehicle occupants.
Provides a reload bonus for all weapons when both seats are occupied.
Reduce the time penalty for exiting the vehicle.
Reduce the time penalty for swapping between seats within the vehicle.
Increases the strafe speed of the vehicle.
Increases the top speed of the vehicle.
Increases the hill climbing ability of the vehicle.
Increases the braking performance of the vehicle.
Increases the Infiltrator's Control Console hacking speed
Increases the Infiltrator's Equipment Terminal hacking speed

Allows the Infiltrator to use EMP grenades. EMP Grenades create a blast that can go through walls and destroy most enemy deployables. Soldiers directly caught in the blast will also have their personal shields and HUD disabled for a few seconds.
Allows the Infiltrator to equip IFF Grenades
Allows the Infiltrator to equip Claymore proximity mines
Increases the recharge rate of your personal shield.
Nanoweave armor is capable of absorbing more damage than its standard issue counterpart
Increases the Infiltrator's knife damage
Reduces cooldowns and increases speed after kills
Allows the Infiltrator to cloak for a short period of time. Movement reduces the effectiveness of the cloak.
While this cloak is active, the Infiltrator takes less damage from kinetic weapons.
While cloaked the infiltrator will move faster but will take more damage
Infiltrator is near invisible even while moving.
Allows the Infiltrator to cloak for extended periods of time
Allows the Infiltrator to become completely invisible briefly

Stalker cloak does not drain energy as long as the infiltrator remains stationary, allowing the cloak to last indefinitely.  However, stalker cloak prevents the use of the infiltrators primary weapon and regenerates slower than normal cloak.
Allows the use of the Recon Detection Device, which reveals nearby enemies on the minimap.
Allows the use of the EMP Spiker, which damages nearby enemy shields and disrupts enemy cloaks
Allows the use of the Scrambler, which disrupts nearby enemy's minimap

Drifter Jump Jets allow the user to glide for long periods of time, but lacks the vertical thrust of other jump jet types.
Icarus Jump Jets provide significantly faster vertical thrust and fuel recharge rate at the cost of in-air maneuverability and overall fuel capacity.
Skirmisher Jump Jets provide balanced thrust, mobility, fuel capacity, and recharge rate, allowing them to adapt to most situations.

Nanite Revive Grenades revive nearby friendly soldiers upon detonation.

Streamlines the vehicle's performance in favor of dogfighting manuevers.  It Improves the turn power, roll power and overall agility of the vehicle.
Improves the vehicle's ability to engage ground targets by increasing its hover strength and power of vertical thrusters.
Improves the top speed of the vehicle in both cruising and afterburner modes.
Streamlines the Reaver's performance in favor of dogfighting manuevers.  It Improves the turn power, roll power and overall agility of the Reaver.

Streamlines the Mosquito's performance in favor of dogfighting manuevers.  It Improves the turn power, roll power and overall agility of the Mosquito.
Improves the Mosquito's ability to engage ground targets by increasing its hover strength and power of vertical thrusters.
Improves the top speed of the Mosquito in both cruising and afterburner modes.

A heavier airframe but stronger engine provides improved vertical thrust, pitch manueverability, and agility.
Improves the top speed of the Liberator in both cruising and afterburner modes.
A streamlined airframe allows the Galaxy to perform more precise manuevers by improving its turn rate, roll rate, and airbrake power.
A heavier airframe but stronger engine provides improved vertical thrust, pitch manueverability, and agility.
Improves the top speed and acceleration of the Galaxy.

Enables the Sunderer to deploy into an Advanced Mobile Station, which acts as a respawn point for friendly soldiers.  The AMS must be stopped to deploy and cannot be deployed immediately near enemy bases or other deployed friendly Sunderers.
Enables the Galaxy to deploy into an Advanced Mobile Station.  The AMS acts as a respawn point for friendly soldiers and also places a fortification shield around the Galaxy.

Utilizing a holographic red dot and 3.4x magnification, the NC's Laser-Assisted Combat Optics has significant flexibility over other mid-range scopes.
Featuring 3.4x magnification and a simple crosshair, OcuLuxx's Tacti-Eye owes its success to its simplicity and ease of use.
OcuLuxx's sturdy Mark IV scope features 4x magnification and a triple chevron reticle, allowing the user to compensate for bullet drop.
The TrueShot makes use of a simple crosshair and 4x magnification. Its lightweight 'box' housing obscures less than typical scopes of its class.
The New Conglomerate's versatile Bolt Driver Standard uses a mil-dot reticle and 6x magnification.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
TekLyte's standard reflex sight allows for superior close-range target acquisition over traditional iron sights.
The RefleXR from Genudine Dynamics includes 2x magnification, making it the preferred sight for urban combat scenarios.
Adds an additional 4 rounds to the magazine capacity.

The rail mounted Darklight Flashlight can illuminate hostile cloaked infiltrators and dark areas but the light can give away your position.

The light can be turned on and off with Toggle Attachment.
Allows use of a forward grip. Forward grips increase the user's control of the weapon, reducing horizontal recoil.
A laser sight increases the user's hipfire accuracy by 33%.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.
Using a red dot reticle with 3.4x optical magnification, the TR's Holographic Dot Sight performs well in close and mid-range combat scenarios.
Equipped with a combination chevron/crosshair reticle and 3.4x magnification capabilities, the TR's Designated Marksman Optics functions well at many ranges.
The Terran Republic's Advanced Combat Scope utilizes a triple chevron reticle and 4x magnification, making it a good choice for all-around use.
Sharpshooters have long preferred the Terran Marksman Scope, praising its simple 4x magnified crosshair for its versatility and efficiency.
The 6x magnified S3 comes standard on many Terran sniper rifles. Its moderate zoom level and mil-dot sighting makes it perfect for mid-to-long range combat.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
The TR's Rapid Target Acquisition sight provides no magnification, but uses a clear red dot sight for close-combat situations.
The Terran MH2 features 2x magnification inside of a holographic red dot sight, giving it the advantage in urban combat situations.
Doubles the amount of ammunition in each magazine, and the weapon takes 20% longer to equip and unequip.

The rail mounted Darklight Flashlight can illuminate hostile cloaked infiltrators and dark areas but the light can give away your position.

The light can be turned on and off with Toggle Attachment.
The Ballistic Rapid Refire Toggle overclocks the Mini-Chaingun's motor drive, allowing it to spool up 50% faster.
A laser sight increases the user's hipfire accuracy by 33%.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.
Within its ornate triangular housing, the V3 Holo uses a red dot sight and 3.4x magnification for mid-range combat scenarios.
The Vanu Marksman's Scope is the standard for mid-range engagements. It uses a minimalist chevron reticle inside of its Vanu-styled housing.

Created to better suit carbines and assault rifles for support roles, the OG-4's simple crosshair allows the user to make accurate shots at a distance. It uses 4x magnification perfect for mid-range fights.
The CSZ's 4x magnification make it a favorite amongst designated marksmen in the Vanu Sovereignty. This scope uses a triple chevron reticle.
The TriGon-6 won the Vanu Sovereignty's bid as their standard sniper scope. It features 6x magnification and standard mil-dot sighting.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
Designed as a replacement for standard iron sights in close-quarters combat, the Holo-Projected Reticle sight creates an accurate red dot reticle above the top rail.
The revolutionary Vanu Holo-Optic reflex utilizes nanotechnology to project a circle and dot reticle. Additionally, it features a 2X magnitude zoom for better performance in urban combat scenarios.

The light can be turned on and off with Toggle Attachment.

A laser sight increases the user's hipfire accuracy by 33%.

Reduces the time it takes to reload the weapon.
Reduce the acquire timer for pulling this vehicle.
Increases the Idle Timer on the vehicle so that it remains in the game for longer when left unattended.  The default time is 5 minutes.
Creates a smoke screen around the vehicle which masks you and nearby allied vehicles.
When activated, the Fire Suppression System will repair damage for 5 seconds.  If the vehicle is on fire when activated, it will also immediately extinguish the fire.
Creates a smoke screen around the vehicle that makes it difficult to see and prevents lock-ons for several seconds.  Can be activated once every 60 seconds.
When activated, the vehicle is encased in a coating that allows it to slip through enemy gate shields and avoid damage when colliding with other vehicles.
Nanites repair damage over time as long as the vehicle has not taken damage within a few seconds.
Stealth increases the time for seeking weapons to establish a lock and also reduces the range at which the vehicle will automatically appear to enemies via proximity or radar.
Improves the ability of the Harasser to dart in and out of combat and line up targets by improving traction, turning rate, brakes, and reverse speed.
Improves how well the Harasser performs when off roading by increasing handling and hill climbing.
Improves the top speed and acceleration of the Harasser.
Increases the total durability of the vehicle.
Detects the movement of hostile soldiers near the vehicle and reveals them on the mini-map for all vehicle occupants.
Increases turbo fuel regeneration rate.  An empty fuel tank will refill completely in 27.5 seconds.

Enables the Sunderer to deploy into an Advanced Mobile Station, which acts as a respawn point for friendly soldiers.  The AMS must be stopped to deploy and cannot be deployed immediately near enemy bases or other deployed friendly Sunderers.

The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The TR's Rapid Target Acquisition sight provides no magnification, but uses a clear red dot sight for close-combat situations.
The Terran MH2 features 2x magnification inside of a holographic red dot sight, giving it the advantage in urban combat situations.
Using a red dot reticle with 3.4x optical magnification, the TR's Holographic Dot Sight performs well in close and mid-range combat scenarios.
The Terran Republic's Advanced Combat Scope utilizes a triple chevron reticle and 4x magnification, making it a good choice for all-around use.
Sharpshooters have long preferred the Terran Marksman Scope, praising its simple 4x magnified crosshair for its versatility and efficiency.
The 6x magnified S3 comes standard on many Terran sniper rifles. Its moderate zoom level and mil-dot sighting makes it perfect for mid-to-long range combat.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
Using a red dot reticle with 3.4x optical magnification, the TR's Holographic Dot Sight performs well in close and mid-range combat scenarios.

The rail mounted Darklight Flashlight can illuminate hostile cloaked infiltrators and dark areas but the light can give away your position.

The light can be turned on and off with Toggle Attachment.
A laser sight increases the user's hipfire accuracy by 33%.
Allows use of a forward grip. Forward grips increase the user's control of the weapon, reducing horizontal recoil.

Increases aimed accuracy when moving.

Doubles the amount of ammunition in each magazine, and the weapon takes 20% longer to equip and unequip.

A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.

Reduces the timer for acquiring a MAX.
Reduces the timer for acquiring a MAX.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
TekLyte's standard reflex sight allows for superior close-range target acquisition over traditional iron sights.
The RefleXR from Genudine Dynamics includes 2x magnification, making it the preferred sight for urban combat scenarios.
Utilizing a holographic red dot and 3.4x magnification, the NC's Laser-Assisted Combat Optics has significant flexibility over other mid-range scopes.
The TrueShot makes use of a simple crosshair and 4x magnification. Its lightweight 'box' housing obscures less than typical scopes of its class.
OcuLuxx's sturdy Mark IV scope features 4x magnification and a triple chevron reticle, allowing the user to compensate for bullet drop.
The New Conglomerate's versatile Bolt Driver Standard uses a mil-dot reticle and 6x magnification.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.

The rail mounted Darklight Flashlight can illuminate hostile cloaked infiltrators and dark areas but the light can give away your position.

The light can be turned on and off with Toggle Attachment.
A laser sight increases the user's hipfire accuracy by 33%.
Allows use of a forward grip. Forward grips increase the user's control of the weapon, reducing horizontal recoil.
Underbarrel smoke grenade launcher that produces a large smoke screen capable of providing cover for a short period of time. The added weight increases the equip time of the attached weapon.
A single-shot shotgun round that is highly effective in close quarters combat. The added weight increases the equip time of the attached weapon.
A single-shot grenade launcher that can be attached under the barrel of the rifle. The added weight increases the equip time of the attached weapon.
Soft Point Ammunition increases the weapon's maximum damage range by 5 meters, but reduces its projectile velocity by 5%.
High Velocity Ammunition increases the weapon's projectile velocity by 5% and minimum damage range by 20 meters, but reduces the weapon's maximum damage range by 2 meters.

Increased shield penetration at the expense of slightly less damage against other target types.
Soft Point Ammunition increases the weapon's maximum damage range by 5 meters, but reduces its projectile velocity by 5%.
High Velocity Ammunition increases the weapon's projectile velocity by 5% and minimum damage range by 20 meters, but reduces the weapon's maximum damage range by 2 meters.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.
Utilizing a holographic red dot and 3.4x magnification, the NC's Laser-Assisted Combat Optics has significant flexibility over other mid-range scopes.
Featuring 3.4x magnification and a simple crosshair, OcuLuxx's Tacti-Eye owes its success to its simplicity and ease of use.
The TrueShot makes use of a simple crosshair and 4x magnification. Its lightweight 'box' housing obscures less than typical scopes of its class.
OcuLuxx's sturdy Mark IV scope features 4x magnification and a triple chevron reticle, allowing the user to compensate for bullet drop.
The New Conglomerate's versatile Bolt Driver Standard uses a mil-dot reticle and 6x magnification.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
TekLyte's standard reflex sight allows for superior close-range target acquisition over traditional iron sights.
The RefleXR from Genudine Dynamics includes 2x magnification, making it the preferred sight for urban combat scenarios.

The light can be turned on and off with Toggle Attachment.

Increased shield penetration at the expense of slightly less damage against other target types.
Soft Point Ammunition increases the weapon's maximum damage range by 5 meters, but reduces its projectile velocity by 5%.
High Velocity Ammunition increases the weapon's projectile velocity by 5% and minimum damage range by 20 meters, but reduces the weapon's maximum damage range by 2 meters.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.
Utilizing a holographic red dot and 3.4x magnification, the NC's Laser-Assisted Combat Optics has significant flexibility over other mid-range scopes.
Featuring 3.4x magnification and a simple crosshair, OcuLuxx's Tacti-Eye owes its success to its simplicity and ease of use.
The TrueShot makes use of a simple crosshair and 4x magnification. Its lightweight 'box' housing obscures less than typical scopes of its class.
OcuLuxx's sturdy Mark IV scope features 4x magnification and a triple chevron reticle, allowing the user to compensate for bullet drop.
The New Conglomerate's versatile Bolt Driver Standard uses a mil-dot reticle and 6x magnification.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
TekLyte's standard reflex sight allows for superior close-range target acquisition over traditional iron sights.
The RefleXR from Genudine Dynamics includes 2x magnification, making it the preferred sight for urban combat scenarios.

The light can be turned on and off with Toggle Attachment.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.
Utilizing a holographic red dot and 3.4x magnification, the NC's Laser-Assisted Combat Optics has significant flexibility over other mid-range scopes.
Featuring 3.4x magnification and a simple crosshair, OcuLuxx's Tacti-Eye owes its success to its simplicity and ease of use.
The TrueShot makes use of a simple crosshair and 4x magnification. Its lightweight 'box' housing obscures less than typical scopes of its class.
OcuLuxx's sturdy Mark IV scope features 4x magnification and a triple chevron reticle, allowing the user to compensate for bullet drop.
The New Conglomerate's versatile Bolt Driver Standard uses a mil-dot reticle and 6x magnification.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
TekLyte's standard reflex sight allows for superior close-range target acquisition over traditional iron sights.
The RefleXR from Genudine Dynamics includes 2x magnification, making it the preferred sight for urban combat scenarios.

The rail mounted Darklight Flashlight can illuminate hostile cloaked infiltrators and dark areas but the light can give away your position.

The light can be turned on and off with Toggle Attachment.
Allows use of a forward grip. Forward grips increase the user's control of the weapon, reducing horizontal recoil.

Using a red dot reticle with 3.4x optical magnification, the TR's Holographic Dot Sight performs well in close and mid-range combat scenarios.
Equipped with a combination chevron/crosshair reticle and 3.4x magnification capabilities, the TR's Designated Marksman Optics functions well at many ranges.
The Terran Republic's Advanced Combat Scope utilizes a triple chevron reticle and 4x magnification, making it a good choice for all-around use.
Sharpshooters have long preferred the Terran Marksman Scope, praising its simple 4x magnified crosshair for its versatility and efficiency.
The 6x magnified S3 comes standard on many Terran sniper rifles. Its moderate zoom level and mil-dot sighting makes it perfect for mid-to-long range combat.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
The TR's Rapid Target Acquisition sight provides no magnification, but uses a clear red dot sight for close-combat situations.
The Terran MH2 features 2x magnification inside of a holographic red dot sight, giving it the advantage in urban combat situations.

The rail mounted Darklight Flashlight can illuminate hostile cloaked infiltrators and dark areas but the light can give away your position.

The light can be turned on and off with Toggle Attachment.
A laser sight increases the user's hipfire accuracy by 33%.
Replaces the default bolt with a heavier, explosive tipped variant that does moderate damage to MAX units and armored targets, reduces the number of shots in the magazine by one.
Replaces the default bolt with a low damage variant that includes a sensor device. The sensor can detect enemy movement within a limited range.

Soft Point Ammunition increases the weapon's maximum damage range by 5 meters, but reduces its projectile velocity by 5%.
High Velocity Ammunition increases the weapon's projectile velocity by 5% and minimum damage range by 20 meters, but reduces the weapon's maximum damage range by 2 meters.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.

Allows use of a forward grip. Forward grips increase the user's control of the weapon, reducing horizontal recoil.
A laser sight increases the user's hipfire accuracy by 33%.
Increased armor penetration at the expense of slightly less damage against other target types.
Increased shield penetration at the expense of slightly less damage against other target types.
Soft Point Ammunition increases the weapon's maximum damage range by 5 meters, but reduces its projectile velocity by 5%.
High Velocity Ammunition increases the weapon's projectile velocity by 5% and minimum damage range by 20 meters, but reduces the weapon's maximum damage range by 2 meters.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.
Within its ornate triangular housing, the V3 Holo uses a red dot sight and 3.4x magnification for mid-range combat scenarios.
The Vanu Marksman's Scope is the standard for mid-range engagements. It uses a minimalist chevron reticle inside of its Vanu-styled housing.

Created to better suit carbines and assault rifles for support roles, the OG-4's simple crosshair allows the user to make accurate shots at a distance. It uses 4x magnification perfect for mid-range fights.
The CSZ's 4x magnification make it a favorite amongst designated marksmen in the Vanu Sovereignty. This scope uses a triple chevron reticle.
The TriGon-6 won the Vanu Sovereignty's bid as their standard sniper scope. It features 6x magnification and standard mil-dot sighting.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
Designed as a replacement for standard iron sights in close-quarters combat, the Holo-Projected Reticle sight creates an accurate red dot reticle above the top rail.
The revolutionary Vanu Holo-Optic reflex utilizes nanotechnology to project a circle and dot reticle. Additionally, it features a 2X magnitude zoom for better performance in urban combat scenarios.

Soft Point Ammunition increases the weapon's maximum damage range by 5 meters, but reduces its projectile velocity by 5%.
High Velocity Ammunition increases the weapon's projectile velocity by 5% and minimum damage range by 20 meters, but reduces the weapon's maximum damage range by 2 meters.

A compensator redirects gases upward, reducing vertical recoil by 30%. The increased sound pressure will cause the player to show on the minimap 35m farther away, and increased weapon bulk reduces hipfire cone of fire by 15%.
A flash suppressor makes the shooter less visible to the enemy, but increases the range at which you appear on enemy minimaps by 15 meters.
The suppressor reduces the noise and muzzle flash generated by the firearm, and prevents the player from showing on the minimap when firing. Bullet velocity and effectiveness at range are reduced.
Using a red dot reticle with 3.4x optical magnification, the TR's Holographic Dot Sight performs well in close and mid-range combat scenarios.
Equipped with a combination chevron/crosshair reticle and 3.4x magnification capabilities, the TR's Designated Marksman Optics functions well at many ranges.
The Terran Republic's Advanced Combat Scope utilizes a triple chevron reticle and 4x magnification, making it a good choice for all-around use.
Sharpshooters have long preferred the Terran Marksman Scope, praising its simple 4x magnified crosshair for its versatility and efficiency.
The 6x magnified S3 comes standard on many Terran sniper rifles. Its moderate zoom level and mil-dot sighting makes it perfect for mid-to-long range combat.
Nanite Systems' HS/NV scope has no magnification, but provides high contrast outlines to nearby objects and illuminates nearby soldiers.
The TR's Rapid Target Acquisition sight provides no magnification, but uses a clear red dot sight for close-combat situations.
The Terran MH2 features 2x magnification inside of a holographic red dot sight, giving it the advantage in urban combat situations.

The Magrider is a hover tank used exclusively by the Vanu Sovereignty.  Its hover capabilities allow it ability strafe and climb more types of terrain beyond other tanks.
The Scythe is a one man air superiority fighter in use exclusively by the Vanu Sovereignty.  Vanu technology allows the Scythe to be a more stable aircraft when hovering and decelerating.
The Vanguard is a sturdy tank used exclusively by the New Conglomerate.  The vanguard favors heavier front armor compared to other tanks, but this comes at the cost of speed.

The Reaver is a one man air superiority fighter in use exclusively by the New Conglomerate.  Its powerful engines combined with its great afterburner capacity make this aircraft the fastest empire specific fighter in the skies.
The Prowler is a versatile tank used exclusively by the Terran Republic.  It boasts a higher top speed and its twin barrel cannons are capable of inflicting damage quicker than the other tanks.

The Mosquito is a one man air superiority fighter in use exclusively by the Terran Republic.  Decades of refinement have made this aircraft the quickest and most agile of all the empire-specific aircrafts.

When activated, the Fire Suppression System will repair damage for 5 seconds. Prevents overheating when firing while active. If the vehicle is on fire or overheating when activated, it will also immediately remove those effects.

Overheating occurs when firing the primary weapon while deploying into Skylance Battery mode. Find "Deployment: Skylance Battery" passive system in the "Colossus Certs" screen for more details.

Activate MAD draining cortium and for the next several seconds cause shots from the main cannon to do increased damage, travel faster, and pierce vehicles. Each shot however will overheat the weapon's cooling system inflicting damage to the Colossus.

Cannot be used while deployed.

Reduce the damage taken from orbital strikes allowing the vehicle to survive the the blast if it has enough health. In addition, the vehicle is no longer affected by physics impulses from orbital strikes and other weaponized sources.

Fueled by cortium, the 15 meter radius bombardment shield protects the Colossus while it is deployed. When the shield takes damage it draws cortium from the Colossus. If the Colossus runs out of cortium the shield will drop. A friendly ANT may be required to replenish the cortium reserve.
